chapter.title: Getting started with RestComm
chapter.para: In this chapter we will go over the steps necessary to deploy and run RestComm on the localhost for development.

section.title: Using a binary distribution
section.para: The easiest way to get started with RestComm is to download and unzip a binary distribution that includes Mobicents Sip Servlet Container + Mobicents Media Server + RestComm to your local machine.

formalpara.title: JBoss AS Binary Distribution
formalpara.para: In the next few steps we will attempt to do just using a binary distribution based on the JBoss Application Server. We will start by downloading the binary distribution and unzipping it to the working directory.

section.para: Okay now lets start the Mobicents Sip Servlet Container and the Mobicents Media Server.

formalpara.title: Tomcat Binary Distribution
formalpara.para: For those of you who need a more light-weight container we will also cover using a Tomcat based distribution in the following steps.

section.title: Building from source code
section.para: In this section we will download and build RestComm from the Git repository.
section.screen: ~]$ git clone https://code.google.com/p/restcomm/ ~]$ cd restcomm ~]$ mvn package
section.para: The WAR file restcomm.war will be located in the target folder.

formalpara.title: Deploying RestComm
formalpara.para: To deploy RestComm make sure to start the Mobicents Sip Servlet Container and the Mobicents Media Server. Then copy the restcomm.war file to the deployment directory. Finally, open up your favorite softphone and call sip:1234@127.0.0.1:5080
